title: Where can one find examples of good quality open source coding? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is a very good question. I think a lot of good examples aren't the obvious ones. Some that come to mind: Donald Knuth TeX and METAFONT (and in the Literate Programming vein, also the source to lcc, "A retargetable C compiler", http://sites.google.com/site/lccretargetablecompiler/)Doug Crockford's JavaScript (programming language) utilities https://github.com/douglascrockfordSQLiteRuss Cox' Regular Expressions (computing) libraries http://swtch.com/~rsc/regexp/Git — the pinnacle of "macho bit-twidding heroism"[1] in CMany of Daniel J. Bernstein's programs http://cr.yp.to/djb.html (note that djb is also a prolific assembly coder)Google (company) Guava http://code.google.com/p/guava-libraries/LLVMGhostscriptLua (programming language)I've also seen the Clojure (programming language) source cited for excellence[2], but I haven't read it myself.John Cowan. http://home.ccil.org/~cowanDoom 3 — The Exceptional Beauty of Doom 3's Source Codegit.postgresql.orgI'll try to add to this answer over time. [1] quoth User.[2] Dynamic JVM language Complexity and Implementation Line Count

From the demigods themselves : LevelDBhttp://code.google.com/p/leveldb/ C++ Wizardry : Chromium Sourcehttp://www.chromium.org/ John Carmack : Quake Source codehttps://github.com/id-Software/Quake JavaScript - John Resig : jQuery Source codehttp://docs.jquery.com/Source_Code LISP- Peter Norvig : Spell checker http://norvig.com/spell-correct.html Peter Norvig : the entire PAIP book is an incredible piece C - Linus Torvald  : Githttps://github.com/git/git
